page.title: 12SWAFFHAM PRIOR HOUSE
page.content: Swaffham Prior House consists of a house and out buildings standing in a park in the North Western area of our region. It was built in the 17th. Century and is 300 years old. In 1751 the estate was bought by the Allix family from the Rant family and has now been bought, in 1982, by the Marshall family. Not everything at the house was built at once, the Library, Dining Room and Stair Hall were built in the early 17th. Century, the Billiard Room, Conservatory and the Drawing Room were built in the 18th. Century. All the rest of the 28 rooms are modern. Next door to the house is an older cottage dating from the 16th. Century. It has an up and downstairs, is timber framed and plastered with a tiled gabled roof. The cottage has a clock with bells which ring every quarter of an hour.
